page.title: 19CHANGING SCENE FARNWORTH
page.content: When we looked at some Ordinance Survey Maps of the area which had been published in the 1950's we were amazed at the changes there had been in the last thirty years. On Longcauseway for example there were a number of cotton and rayon mills.There were the Oak Mills and Pandora Mills on Longcauseway.These mills have long since gone but part of Moorfield Mill is still standing.Around Longcauseway there were also many mill reservoirs,in fact there was a reservoir between Booth Street and Longcauseway where the present Total Petrol Station is standing. Off Albert is a very old building which used to be the New Empire Cinema.There are tramlines going into the cinema and we discovered it used to be the tram depot.
